snippet: LOPEZ LECUBE--Miguel A. 1919 - 2015 Miguel A. Lopez Lecube, retired representative of the Argentina National Tourist Office in New York, died in Buenos Aires on December 22. He was 96 years old. Chacho, as he was known to his family and friends, enjoyed a long and successful career as a sportsman, diplomat and advocate for tourism. He was an outstanding athlete at the universities of Buenos Aires and Stanford. He served Argentina as Second Secretary of its embassy, Counsel in New York, and Representative for Tourism, the position he held until his retirement in 2006. For some years he also represented the Mexican National Tourist Council under former president Miguel Aleman. In the 1960s Chacho married Kathy Russo and became the father of two daughters, Alexandra and Michele. Chacho is survived by his daughters, his niece Cristina, grandnephews Salvador and Santiago, his grandnieces Teresa and Titin, and great-grandnieces and nephews. He was interred in his family's mausoleum at the Recoleta Cemetery on December 24, 2015. He will be deeply missed. 1/3
